{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3169599,"name":"Ryan zheng","username":"Rzheng1232","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rzheng1232/{size}/182897_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-21T17:46:33.211Z","cooked":"

Hello,
Is there any way to create a trajectory in pathplanner that runs some commands in parallel and some commands in a sequence? For example, when the robot is scoring a piece, I want the robot to stop and raise its arm before continuing on the trajectory while on another section of the path, I want the intake to be running while the robot is driving towards the game pece.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-03-21T17:46:33.211Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":465,"reads":125,"readers_count":124,"score":2345.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":431153,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-both-parallel-and-sequential-commands","display_username":"Ryan zheng","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55168,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Programmer"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-both-parallel-and-sequential-commands/431153/1","custom_user_title":"Programmer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3169605,"name":"Curt Rozeboom","username":"BlueEpiphone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/blueepiphone/{size}/197122_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-21T17:51:07.161Z","cooked":"

We write combo commands with sequential operations that are then run in parallel with the path.

autoMaps.addMarker("AutoExtendDrop", new MoveElevator(elevatorSubsystem, () -> ElevatorLevel.medium)
    .andThen(new IntakeSpin(intakeSubsystem, () -> -0.3).withTimeout(0.5)));

autoMaps.addMarker("AutoGroundPickUp",
    new PivotElevator(pivotSubsystem, ElevatorLevel.ground)
        .andThen(new MoveElevator(elevatorSubsystem, () -> ElevatorLevel.ground)));
","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-03-21T17:51:07.161Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":14,"reads":120,"readers_count":119,"score":99.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":431153,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-both-parallel-and-sequential-commands","display_username":"Curt Rozeboom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32089,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5010 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-both-parallel-and-sequential-commands/431153/2","custom_user_title":"5010 Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3169606,"name":"Ryan zheng","username":"Rzheng1232","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rzheng1232/{size}/182897_2.png","created_at":"2023-03-21T17:52:44.530Z","cooked":"

Oh, I see, so the first statement forces the robot to wait for 0.5 seconds before continuing along the path giving the robot time to score the game piece while the second statement just runs the intake while continuing along the path. Thanks!

Yep, and you can do other kinds of combos to add parallel commands into this also. The API is fairly rich. Command (WPILib API 2023.4.2)

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2023-03-21T17:55:01.147Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":16,"reads":104,"readers_count":103,"score":115.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":431153,"topic_slug":"pathplanner-both-parallel-and-sequential-commands","display_username":"Curt Rozeboom","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.wpilib.org/allwpilib/docs/release/java/edu/wpi/first/wpilibj2/command/Command.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Command (WPILib API 2023.4.2)","clicks":33}],"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":55168,"username":"Rzheng1232","name":"Ryan zheng","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rzheng1232/{size}/182897_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":32089,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5010 Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/pathplanner-both-parallel-and-sequential-commands/431153/4","custom_user_title":"5010 Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3169615,"name":"Vincent Yang","username":"vyang2968","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/aeb1de/{size}.png","created_at":"2023-03-21T17:57:27.933Z","cooked":"

If you want the robot to stop and complete actions before continuing on the path, make that point a stop point and then add the rest of your commands. For running a command at the same time as the robot is moving, you can use a event marker. Depends on how your commands are structured though, also. If that intake command is a RunCommand, just stop it at a later marker with another command. At least, that’s how we did it.
